result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan F. Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Dylan F. Turner in court with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim also appears.  Atty. Terry is heard on motion to allow contact with victim and his child.  Atty. Thompson is heard, opposes any modification of the bail.  Atty. Terry argues.  Atty. Thompson is heard on issue of child.  Atty. Terry heard.  Court will not give him the child until he is at least done with anger management, would consider supervised visitations with parents but requires more information.  Motion is held in abeyance until further details can be provided.

(12:47) Defendant Dylan F. Turner in court, in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (will appoint).  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Def. on PO hold; State heard on bond - requests cash bond, heard on reasons; Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 8/27/15 at 1:30pm in Br. 2; Court sets $1,000.00 CASH Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, SAK, dob 9/16/97 or her family members or her residence.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
